arts.ttl: Højbjerg seals Marseille's 3-1 win at Lens after VAR intervention
arts.sum: The decision prompted a chorus of whistles from the home fans, who were further riled to see former Lens player Elye Wahi go on for the visitors. Fulgini pulled one back from close range in the 80th after M’Bala Nzola had two efforts blocked on the line, and Labeau-Lascary thought he’d equalized in the 86th, only for Fulgini’s shove to prove decisive at the other end.

arts.ttl: Rabiot calls for Pogba: “I’d advise him to come to Marseille”
arts.sum: After his impressive double against Italy in the Nations League, French midfielder Adrien Rabiot has turned his focus back to the league and his club, Marseille. During a press conference ahead of the match against Lens, the 29-year-old former Juventus player discussed the future of a player who has just left the Bianconeri, Paul Pogba: “I would advise him to come to Marseille. Paul is a talented player, if he shows all his physical capabilities and is in good shape, he remains a top player. He hasn’t played for a while. It’s complicated to return to high levels.” Rabiot also The post Rabiot calls for Pogba: “I’d advise him to come to Marseille” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: “I am not running away”: De Zerbi stands firm ahead of Marseille’s clash with Lens
arts.sum: Roberto De Zerbi held a fiery press conference ahead of Olympique de Marseille’s upcoming match against RC Lens, firmly addressing speculation about his future with the club. Following a disappointing loss to Auxerre, De Zerbi had previously stated, “If the problem is me, I am ready to leave my salary here and go.” In the latest conference, he emphasized the importance of daily performance, saying, “The moment of truth for me is every day, not just the matches but also the training sessions. Tomorrow is a match worth three points, not twelve. arts.ttl: Marseille coach De Zerbi says he won't quit amid poor home form
arts.sum: Marseille coach Roberto De Zerbi says he won’t leave the club despite hinting before the international break that he might do so. “I’m not going to run away because of what happened.

Following a demoralising loss at home to Auxerre before the international break, it's imperative that Roberto De Zerbi's side get back on track to keep up their push for a top three finish by the end ...
